title: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? viewers angered over tog rating blunder
text:
Nick found himself in hot water on the show (Picture: ITV)

Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? viewers found themselves screaming at the TV on Sunday night after a teacher competing on the show didn’t know what a tog rating was.

Nick Parkhouse, a new father from Croydon left viewers despairing after not knowing the answer to the question: ‘A tog rating is given to which of these household items?’

Surely anyone who has ever changed a bed should know this, right?

Asked to choose between a refrigerator, saucepan, suitcase and duvet, Nick found himself stumped and using his Ask the Audience lifeline on only his fourth question for £1000. Not ideal…

With 94% of the studio audience correctly voting for the duvet, Nick realised that he probably should’ve known the answer, admitting to Jeremy Clarkson: ‘Doesn’t make me look very good, does it?’

And it seems the viewers at home actually agreed with Nick, echoing one comment that asked: ‘He’s a Teacher so how on earth does he not know the answer this simple question?’

This guy is a teacher? God help his students. #WhoWantsToBeAMillionaire — Varun Sharma (@varshar88) October 6, 2019

Don't know what was more worrying. The fact he didn't know it was duvet, or the fact 3% of the audience thought it was refrigerator#WhoWantsToBeAMillionaire — Connor Watson 🌹 (@CWTV156479) October 6, 2019

‘Don’t know what was more worrying,’ another added, ‘The fact he didn’t know it was duvet, or the fact 3% of the audience thought it was refrigerator.’

Also a fair point.

Adding insult to injury (and really not helping himself), the dad-of-one dug himself into an even bigger hole after justifying his lack of knowledge by saying that his wife Charlotte, who was supporting him in the audience ‘does all the housework.’ Yikes.

Fans were pretty enraged by the teacher’s poor choice of words, with one writing: ‘Forgot we were in the Victorian era’ while another said ‘we’re not in 1950 anymore mate, pull ya f***in weight!’

He has a 3 month old at home?? And his wife does all the housework?? Poor thing must be shattered. Bet he hogs the duvet too, all 20togs of it #whowantstobeamillionaire — Calico Lor (@calico_gifts) October 6, 2019

So his excuse for not knowing that a tog rating is used on a duvet is that 'his wife does all the housework' #whowantstobeamillionaire pic.twitter.com/qI0WkGHOBw — M/T (@megamouth_88) October 6, 2019

‘What we’ve learnt so far is that [Nick] doesn’t do any housework,’ Jeremy mocked, eliciting laughs from the audience.

What’s a duvet got to do with housework?

he should lose just for that comment alone #whowantstobeamillionaire — Ms Fab (@MsDiva_Fabulous) October 6, 2019

Later using his Phone a Friend to lifeline to ask his mum what a monkey-nut was (something the viewers also were annoyed by), Nick miraculously made it to the £16,000 mark and is set to return next week to continue his game.

We all have our knowledge blind spots: even teachers!

Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? airs Sundays at 8pm on ITV.
